profileAlternative.name: Anil Kumar
profileAlternative.headline: Datacenter Performance Architect at Intel Corporation
profileAlternative.summary:
Over the years, I have traversed unique path in runtimes optimizations, performance, and scaling, open source, leading standards, architecting benchmarks, understanding and influencing emerging ecosystems as well as enterprise production environments of bare-metal and cloud. My specialization in computer architecture with electrical engineering background and proven record of delivering and working across enterprise customers have complemented my skills of team building and leading in futuristic unchartered opportunities.

Now, I am looking for a role to continue to learn about new technologies in enterprise and cloud as well as strategically enabling ecosystems to leverage latest SW and HW technologies for optimal performance and maximizing ROI (Return on Investment). My passion is to lead projects involving diverse groups working on performance analysis including developing tools, benchmarks, methodology etc. and best of all, wrapping my mind around huge amount of performance data and analytics.

As chair of the Java committee at SPEC, I have successfully lead teams to derive benchmarks where competing companies have divergent views and end goals. This committee is responsible for all Java benchmarks at SPEC and has released one of the most popular Java benchmark SPECjbb*. I have also represented Intel at Java JCP Executive Committee responsible for future enhancements.

I have played very effective role of Java Evangelist at various industry forums like JavaOne, SouJava Brazil and Java User groups. I have delivered several presentations and keynotes about the role of Intel in Java as well as Java Optimizations on IA. During last three years I have managed runtimes .NET for one year and later scripting language runtimes team with special responsibility for Node.js by establishing Intel as one the core members of Node.js community. In addition, playing important role in understanding emerging containers and FaaS (Function as a Service) where Node.js is key.

positions.title: Intel Corporation
positions.description:
As datacenter performance architect, my role and responsibilities are:
+ Current usages of datacenter by various customers in the cloud as well as on-prem
+ Understanding future trends for datacenter usages, architecture, competition, etc.
+ Collaborate across the industry to create representative workloads and benchmarks
+ Share best-known methods for optimal performance and response time for production deployments
+ Pathfinding for complete end-to-end platforms for future architectures

positions.title: Chair OSGjava/SPEC and Intel Representative
positions.description:
Java Chair (May 2014 - present)
Java Vice-Chair (2004 - May 2014)

Role:
+ Developing industry standard benchmarks which represent latest eco-system as well as fairly represent diverse platforms and architectures with relevant metrics

Key achievements:
+ Key member of team which developed SPECjbb2005 benchmark
+ As industry was looking for a power and performance benchmark, played key role in architecting industry first power and performance benchmark SPECpower_ssj2008. This is one of the most established benchmark for power and performance.
+ Architected benchmark SPECjvm2008 which is a suite of several medium size benchmarks
+ Architected as well as lead SPECjbb2015 development team
+ SPECjbb2015 has many first in any industry standard benchmark features like response time with sub-millisecond granularity across the complete range of utilization from idle to full system utilization.
+ Benchmark has two metrics: max-jOPS representing full systems capacity and critical-jOPS indicating responsiveness of the system under SLA (Service Level Agreement)
+ A detailed Response-Throughput Curve for detailed performance analysis
+ Benchmark also has three deployment categories to cover single JVM scaling, multiple JVM scaling as well as deployment inside Cloud and Virtualization environments
+ As SPEC (www.spec.org) chair for Java subcommittee, lead the effort to release SPECjbb2015 v1.01 which addresses Java JDK 9.0 related changes
+ Received SPECtacular award from SPEC President for leading the release of SPECjbb2015 benchmark

Colleagues in SPEC.org, partners and competitors alike, gave Anil a SPECtacular award for outstanding work on SPECjbb2013. The new benchmark includes Java 7 features, XML, compressed communication, secure messaging, virtualization and cloud computing support, and a metric of critical throughput under service-level agreements (SLAs) specifying response times. Anil has been an excellent vice-chair of the Java committee, and has done an excellent job co-leading SPECjbb2013 development.

received.text: I collaborated with Gaurav for Node.js project. I found him to be amazing strategic thinker, flawless execution as well as someone you can trust. During the ambiguous phases of the project, Gaurav helped in open dialogue and guided to reach decisions which serves the interests of all Node community as well as enterprise. He has excellent technical knowledge and he is gifted when communicating complex issues across diverse groups with competing interest. One can also tell the character of a person based on responsiveness during the time of need. Whenever I needed some strategic thinking discussion, he was always very responsive even when on vacation half way across the world. Gaurav is a great strategic and technical leader for any group and community.

Mihai is excellent in Java programming, architecture and debug applications. For his work as part of SPECjbb2015, he debugged the issues and provided very robust solution. I would recommended Mihai without any hesitation.
